greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => f(i) = f(j), where f(n) = A324537(n) for all other numbers, except f(1) = 0.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
A003557(n) = { my(f=factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i, 2] = f[i, 2]-1); factorback(f); }; \\ From A003557
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 07 2019
